CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 24, 1944, pg. 13, reads: "Sitting Pretty - And that's no kidding. Just in case you can't get a good look at June Eckstein [Eckstine] in photo at the top of the page, we have here a larger photo for pin-up purposes.  In addition to being featured vocalist with Snub Mosley's orchestra, June is Billy Eckstein's [Eckstine's] wife.  She is five feet, two and a half inches tall, weighs 110 pounds.  Likes tennis, horseback riding and golf.  Favorite song is 'Somehow.' Owns a Doberman pinscher dog she calls 'Commando.' - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of June Eckstine wearing long floral dress and flowers in hair, standing in front of mirror, possibly in Club Brazil, Houston, Pennsylvania
